channel.title: System 100 (human league being boiled percussion)
channel.description: not sure if this is the right section, please correct me if I'm wrong. I'm trying to recreate the system 100 percussion patch from The Human Leagues Being Boiled song, I've sort of created the patch, but I cant seem to recreate the actual rhythm, because what should be the 'snare' type part, seems to end up triggering first, even though I know the 'bass drum' part should be first, what the heck am I doing wrong? should I be using some sort of 'sync' module to keep them where they should be? also, would be helpful if I could have some sort of midi keyboard trigger to set it off, instead of switching on the software and bang it starts ;) wouldnt be good live. cheers in advance Sean p.s. not sure how i can include the patch so you see what I mean.

item.title: System 100 (human league being boiled percussion)
item.dc:creator: @Sputnki Filippo Tamagnini
item.description:
@Sputnki wrote:

Are you using the counter object for the sequencer?
Consider that when triggered the counter object advances of 1 step, and the "default" state is 0.
The correct way to patch a sequencer takes this into account, and when you press play (and only in that occurrence) you should reset the counter (via the reset inlet) instead of triggering it.

Clear enough?

Read full topic

item.title: System 100 (human league being boiled percussion)
item.dc:creator: @dark_angeluk1 Sean Crighton-Hara
item.description:
@dark_angeluk1 wrote:

not sure if this is the right section, please correct me if I'm wrong.
I'm trying to recreate the system 100 percussion patch from The Human Leagues Being Boiled song, I've sort of created the patch, but I cant seem to recreate the actual rhythm, because what should be the 'snare' type part, seems to end up triggering first, even though I know the 'bass drum' part should be first, what the heck am I doing wrong? should I be using some sort of 'sync' module to keep them where they should be?
also, would be helpful if I could have some sort of midi keyboard trigger to set it off, instead of switching on the software and bang it starts wouldnt be good live.
cheers in advance
Sean
p.s. not sure how i can include the patch so you see what I mean.
